inference:
$$\begin{split} x+40&=180 \\\ x&=180-40 \\\ x&=\boxed{140}. \end{split}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{140}.$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since the angles along a straight line add to $180^\circ$, then $x^\circ+40^\circ=180^\circ$ or $x+40=180$ or $x=\boxed{140}$.
